alert.note: Alert for Coastal Bryan; Coastal Chatham; Inland Bryan; Inland Chatham; Inland Liberty (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 6:20PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF BRYAN, LIBERTY AND CHATHAM COUNTIES... At 620 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Flemington to near Burroughs, and moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph, up to penny sized hail and excessive cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to plants, trees and crops is possible. Damage to windshields is unlikely. All outdoor activities should cease. Move indoors immediately. Some locations in the path of these storms include... Hinesville, Pooler, Richmond Hill, Fort Stewart, I-16/I-95 Interchange, Hunter Army Airfield, Midtown Savannah, and Coffee Bluff. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to flooding of low lying and poor drainage areas. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
